Posts.Content: Tabatha00 wrote: My sister was dx w/bc when she was 29 (she's now 42 and doing wonderful).  I was dx w/bc when I was 37 in May 2009.   I have a twin sister who just called me and said she has a tiny "cyst" like thing above her arm pit like in the fat of her arm.  (we are on the heavy side....lol)   She freaked out a little bit and I freaked out a little bit.  She said it was about the size of an eraser.  Should she freak out?   If it was a cancerous lump wouldn't it be IN her armpit instead of the fat of her arm?   I'm asking because I had bilateral mastectomies and so I have no feeling in my armpit and down to where my breasts used to be.  I do, however, still have the fat above the armpit that is not breast tissue. Can someone calm my fears?  I'm praying about it but I don't want my sister to go through what I've been through.  Tabatha  Dx 5/22/2009, IDC, 2cm, Grade 3, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Question - a little nervous Tabatha00 Faith316

Posts.Content: Tabatha00 wrote: I had my first chemo last Thursday.     My Dr's gave me the Neulasta shot on my way out.    They said my white blood cells would tank on day 7 and they did.   That's when I noticed my armpits hurting.    Now I have 4 small size knots in my armpits with what looks like the head of a pimple on top of them.    Has anyone else had this?    I can feel the knots on the surface and they do hurt like a pimple that needs to be popped.   There is no way I'm even going to attempt to do that for one but is this normal? I'm so trying not to freak out but I can't help it.   Can somebody please tell me if this is normal or nothing to worry about?    I've already had all my scans, etc., Dx 5/22/2009, IDC, 2cm, Grade 3, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: FREAKING OUT (but trying not to) Tabatha00 yasminv1
Survivor- How to count the years? Tabatha00 Raj20

Posts.Content: Tabatha00 wrote: Has anyone taken Abraxane?     I just finished my last A/C treatment THANK YOU GOD!!!!!!    I was going to have 12 weekly Taxol treatments after the A/C's but my oncologist said he is putting me on Abraxane for 12 weekly treatments.  He said research has shown it's a better drug than Taxol and isn't as toxic for the body.  I'm just wondering if anyone has taken Abraxane and could give me some details about it?   How long is the infusion?   Did you have any side efffects that kind of thing.    Thanks in advance! Dx 5/22/2009, IDC, 2cm, Grade 3, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply

When do we start counting our years out from cancer?  For example. I was diagnosed with bc on May 22, 2009 I had my bilateral mastectomies March 1, 2010 I finished all treatments on May 24, 2010. What date do I start counting from?  Dx 5/22/2009, IDC, 2cm, Grade 3, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Nov 12, 2010 08:03AM Tabatha00 wrote: I was confused because I'm triple negative and they say if you can make it past the 2 or 3 year mark then the risk of recurrence drops significantly.  I'd rather count from May 22, 2009.   ha

Posts.Title: Taxol - How long does it take? Tabatha00 shadow38

Posts.Content: Jan 20, 2011 01:00PM Tabatha00 wrote: When I was first diagnosed with cancer (triple negative) I had CT scan, bone scan and chest x-ray.  No PET because my oncologist think the PET scans have too many false positive readings.  My tumor was 2.5 cm.  It was after I had the CT scan that it showed I had a 2 cm tumor dangling from the bottom pole of my kidney.  I had a biopsy and bingo.......kidney cancer.  However, it was grade 1 and slow growing.  I had the tumor removed and no further treatment is needed.  The radiologist who performed the biopsy called the kidney cancer an "incidental cancer" because most people don't even know they have it until they have scans for something else (in my case breast cancer).   Fast forward and I'm done with chemo and radiation.  I was dx on May 22, 2009.  I finished chemo January 22, 2010 and finished radiation May 24, 2010.   My oncologist does NOT order scans of any kind after treatment is over. He also doesn't do tumor marker tests because he said those are highly unreliable.  I'm FINE with this.  I think ignorance is bliss. HOWEVER, my urologist DOES require scans every year.  I have to have a CT scan and chest x-ray March 21.  I think to myself.  If I hadn't had that damn kidney cancer I could live in denial forever and not have scanxiety!!!!   I asked my urologist what the chances are that the kidney cancer will come back and he shook his head and said "not likely at all but anything is possible in medicine".  I have thought so many times about not having the scan done in March but is that me being irresponsible????   Probably!   DAMN DAMN DAMN!!!!!!   I DON'T WANT TOO!!!!!!   I know I should.  God forbid if the breast cancer ever decided to rear it's ugly head again and I could have caught a recurrence earlier I would never forgive myself.  I just pray pray pray for clear scans on March 21 so I can not worry about tests for another year!!!!!! Tabatha
Posts.Title: Stage II - No scans?? SunnyCoconut Tabatha00

Posts.Content: Tabatha00 wrote: Uh, yeah whatever that word is I'm having mine done on Tuesday, October 5.  lol   I was dx with breast cancer when I was 37 and have quite the family history of breast and ovarian cancer in my family.  My grandmother died from ovarian cancer at 85 and my aunt who got breast cancer when she was 37 passed away from ovarian cancer when she was 47.  She was dx with ovarian cancer when she was 45. Sooooooooo, I had genetic testing and it shows I have a "variant of unknown significance" in the BRCA1 gene.  Because of this the genetic counselor said they don't make a recommendation either way on if you should or should not have any particular surgery.  She said because they don't know if the "variant" is a cancer causing variant or not.  Yeah, well that's all well and good but my family history SCREAMS cancer so I want to get everything ripped out.  lol They did an ultrasound on my ovaries and found they are fine.  I want to get this surgery out of the way because I just finished up with my breast cancer treatment in May and I don't want to do this again.  EVER! I am a little anxious I guess you'd say.  I'm afraid I'm going to have surgery and then when I wake up somebody is going to give me bad news.  When I was doing testing for my breast cancer they also found that I had a tumor in the bottom pole of my kidney and it was renal cell carcinoma.  Thank God we caught it early and they just took that pole dancing kidney tumor out and that's it.  I always go in for one thing but come out with a couple of things.  I was joking to my sister that I hope they don't wake me up from surgery and say "Uh, yes, Tabatha, we removed 14 ovaries, a hairball and a lucky penny".   lol Keeping in mind I had an ultrasound of my ovaries and everything was fine please tell me I'm not going to wake up and someone stand over me and say they found something.  I need reassurance that there isn't going to be a surprise behind door #2.  Does anyone else have an experience with oophroectomy and a history of cancer?   Advice?  Thoughts?  Ways to spend the penny?  lol Thanks, Tabatha Dx 5/22/2009, IDC, 2cm, Grade 3, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Oophroectomy (sp) Tabatha00 Alyad

Posts.Content: Oct 7, 2010 07:06AM Tabatha00 wrote: I haven't noticed any side effects so far.  I wonder how long it will take for my body to notice my ovaries aren't there anymore.   lol
Posts.Title: Oophroectomy (sp) Tabatha00 Alyad

Posts.Content: Oct 6, 2010 09:30PM Tabatha00 wrote: My surgery went great.  I only had my ovaries and tubes removed.  I am in NO pain whatsoever.  Out of all the surgeries I have had I'm glad to FINALLY not feel any pain.  lol   The original plan was for me to stay in the hospital overnight but I was doing so well they let me go home.  WOOP WOOP!!!!!! Honestly, after everything I've been though this surgery has been a piece of cake!!!!   The Dr said everything went great but of course everything has to go through pathology and he said that would be sometime next week.  He's a gyno oncologist so I feel if there was anything to be conerned with he would know by the look of the ovaries and tubes and since they do it laproscopic I'm sure he had a look around before the surgery was over. So, the great news is if you have your ovaries and tubes removed it's alllllllllll good.    lol
Posts.Title: Oophroectomy (sp) Tabatha00 Alyad

Posts.Content: Nov 6, 2010 01:46AM Tabatha00 wrote: My sister had breast cancer when she was 29 (she's now 42 and doing fabulous).  I was dx with bc when I was 37.  I have to tell you that sometimes I think it's harder being the one on the outside looking in than being the one who has cancer.  Do you know if your daughter is ER/PR + or negative? I'd love to be her friend on Face Book.
Posts.Title: So far so good...:-) kirismum shorfi

Posts.Content: Tabatha00 wrote: Oh how I HATE to be here again.   I never thought.   I thought I had Vertigo and finally ended up going to the ER where a CT was done of my head and 3 tumors were found on my brain.  The largest being an inch in diameter.   Since then, I have had 2 of the tumors surgically removed (am at home now) and will be having gamma knife on the smaller spot as well as gamma knife on the tumor beds where the other tumors were taken out.   A CT of my body was done and my brain is the only place the cancer traveled too. I'm looking for words of encouragement.  I'm looking for people who survive brain mets and live productive lives.  My dr's are encouraged at this point but this is all so new to me and something I never thought I'd have to deal with.  I had triple negative breast cancer in May 2009 and have been thru alot in the past 2 years.  As a matter of fact my 2 year cancerversary is coming up May 22.   How is that for timing? I have to meet with my oncologist June 9 to discuss if we are going to do chemo.   I heard something about the blood/brain barrier.   I know I'll probably have to have MRI's on a regular basis to keep the brain checked out but is this something I can survive?   I'm sure there are women who are survivinv it.   CAN SOMEONE OFFER ME ADVICE?    PLEASE!!!!!!!! Is there a forum for women who are going through things like me?   I'm just at a loss but not giving up by any stretch.   Tabatha Dx 5/22/2009, IDC, 2cm, Grade 3, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Brain Mets - Surgery - Gamma Knife Tabatha00 chainsawz

Posts.Content: Apr 29, 2010 11:38AM Tabatha00 wrote: I have to say I'm going to miss my wig too!   How funny!!!!    I'm still rockin a GI Jane-ish hairstyle right now.  I live in Alabama so the summer is HOT and HUMID.  I may be taking off the wig and unveiling the new and improved Tabatha.  lol
Posts.Title: Stage II w/Lymph Node Involvement Warrior517 Moderators

Posts.Content: Jan 20, 2011 12:41PM Tabatha00 wrote: Preachin to the choir my sisters!!!!!  lol    I was dx on May 22, 2009.   I HATE HATE HATE going to the doctor about ANYTHING.   My cold can't just be a "cold".  A headache can't just be a "headache"....it has to be a brain tumor.  UGH!!!!!!   Some days are fine, actually most days are but if I'm coming up on an appointment or test I FAAAAREAK!!!!!   I have my 6 month check-up with my oncologist on February 1.   YUCK!!!!!  I have my year follow-up with my urologist on March 21 where I'll also be having a CT scan and chest x-ray.  PUKE!!!!   When they found my breast cancer and I was going thru all the scans they found out I had a 2 cm tumor dangling from the bottom pole of my kidney.  LUCKY ME had kidney cancer at the same time.  NOT related to the brest cancer thank God!!!!   So, now every year I have to have a CT scan and chest x-ray for the kidney cancer.  It was grade 1 (slowest growing) and my urologist said that kind doesn't usually come back.   Yeah, well I just want the CT to be clear. So, I'm right along there with ya'll.  I'll be so glad when March 21 is over so I can get a clean bill of health (God willing) and I can quit worrying about this pain in my side, my back hurting, my headache and every other ailment I can think I have.  Tabatha
Posts.Title: Panic at ANYTHING medical related bookgirl frustratedrg
